Yang LIU

PhD in Control Science and Engineering

gloolar@gmail.com | Google Scholar | GitHub

Personal Statement

I have over 17 years of academic and industrial experience in biomedical engineering, sensor algorithm, and software development. My expertise and research interests are in biomedical signal processing, machine learning and evolutionary computation. I obtained my Ph.D. in Control Science and Engineering from National University of Defense Technology in China in 2010. From 2003 to 2013, I worked on several biomedical projects where I applied my expertise to brain-machine interfaces and developed novel algorithms for event-related potential pattern recognition and motion control. I co-founded Microsensor Labs in 2016, and developed the original sensor algorithm and firmware for the sanibit™️ product. As the Director of Algorithm Development, my technical responsibilities include sensor algorithm research, prototyping and implementation, system architecture design, as well as presentations in technical conferences and publications in related journals. In the management role, I supervise and manage junior software developers and interns, recruit talents, and work with the marketing team on product features and specifications.

Areas of Expertise

  • Biomedical Signal Processing
  • Machine Learning
  • Brain-Computer Interfaces
  • Event Related Potentials
  • Evolutionary Computation
  • Statistical Modeling and Analysis
  • Sensor information fusion
  • Embedded Software Architecture

Research

2019-22 “A wearable sensor system for hand hygiene compliance tracking”. NIH SBIR project, Phase II (1R44AG060848-02). Co-investigator.

2016-17 “Hang hygiene motion tracking and detection algorithm”. Cleanhands Project of Microsensor Labs. Research and prototyping.

2013-16 “Evolutionary algorithm for large-scale practical vehicle routing problem”. Algorithm research and core library development.

2009-12 “Research on methods and key technologies in brain-computer interaction based on visual and auditory perception and cognition”. Key Program of National Natural Science Foundation of China (No. 90820304). In charge of research of sub-program “brain-computer coordinated control of human motion”

2006-08 “Research on key technologies of the implementation of brain-computer interfaces”. General Program of National Natural Science Foundation of China (No. 60575044). In charge of the research of signal processing and pattern recognition part.

2006-08 “Brain mechanism of motion: research on integrated human-computer system based on multimodal measurement and fusion technology”. Research Program of NUDT. Key researcher.

2004-06 “Research on novel technologies of brain–computer interfaces”. Research Program of NUDT. Key researcher.
